title: How to Make a Coin Can

steps.headline: Collect all materials.
steps.description: These are listed below under "Things You'll Need".

steps.headline: Wash the soup can thoroughly and dry it with a paper towel, remembering to be careful around sharp edges.
steps.description: Buff the can with a slightly dampened paper towel.

steps.headline: Take the sheet of aluminum foil and press it down to the open side of the soup can.
steps.description: Trace around the edge of the can onto the aluminum foil. Carefully remove the template and cut it out. You should end up with a circular template that fits the top of the can.

steps.headline: Glue the template onto the sheet of cardstock with white glue.
steps.description: Remember to press down hard. Cut out the template when the glue has dried.

steps.headline: Fold the template in half, and cut a small rectangle in the folded half.
steps.description: Unfold. This is the slit to slip coins into. Set the template aside.

steps.headline: Measure the height of the soup can, and measure it onto the piece of printer paper.
steps.description: Wrap the paper around the can to get on idea of the circumference. Make a mark with the pencil, and cut off all excess paper.

steps.headline: Draw a big face and clothes on the paper to make it look like the recipient of the can.
Tape the paper around the can and put the template on top of the can.
Draw a small rectangle on the cardstock and cut it out.
steps.description: Cut one of the shorter sides to make it look rounded. This is an arm. Color it in.

steps.headline: Make another arm that looks the same as the one you just made.
If desired, wrap the gift and present it to your recipient!

text: Collect all materials. These are listed below under "Things You'll Need". Wash the soup can thoroughly and dry it with a paper towel, remembering to be careful around sharp edges. Buff the can with a slightly dampened paper towel. Take the sheet of aluminum foil and press it down to the open side of the soup can. Trace around the edge of the can onto the aluminum foil. Carefully remove the template and cut it out. You should end up with a circular template that fits the top of the can. Glue the template onto the sheet of cardstock with white glue. Remember to press down hard. Cut out the template when the glue has dried. Fold the template in half, and cut a small rectangle in the folded half. Unfold. This is the slit to slip coins into. Set the template aside. Measure the height of the soup can, and measure it onto the piece of printer paper. Wrap the paper around the can to get on idea of the circumference. Make a mark with the pencil, and cut off all excess paper. Draw a big face and clothes on the paper to make it look like the recipient of the can.  Tape the paper around the can and put the template on top of the can.  Draw a small rectangle on the cardstock and cut it out. Cut one of the shorter sides to make it look rounded. This is an arm. Color it in. Make another arm that looks the same as the one you just made.  If desired, wrap the gift and present it to your recipient!
